item.title: Microsoft: Exchange 2016 and 2019 reach end of support in October
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has reminded admins that Exchange 2016 and Exchange 2019 will reach the end of extended support in October and shared guidance for those who need to decommission outdated servers. [...]

item.title: HPE investigates breach as hacker claims to steal source code
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) is investigating claims of a new breach after a threat actor said they stole documents from the company's developer environments. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes Windows Server 2022 bug breaking device boot
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has fixed a bug that was causing some Windows Server 2022 systems with two or more NUMA nodes to fail to start up. [...]

item.title: Microsoft shares temp fix for Outlook crashing when writing emails
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has shared a temporary fix for a known issue that causes classic Outlook to crash when writing, replying to, or forwarding an email. [...]

item.title: TikTok is back up in the US after Trump says he will extend deadline
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: TikTok is back up in the United States after Trump announced today that he would extend a 90-day deadline for the company to find a U.S. purchaser. [...]

item.title: TikTok shuts down in the US as Trump throws the company a lifeline
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: TikTok shut down in the U.S. late Saturday night following the Supreme Court's decision to uphold the law that banned the company over national security concerns. [...]

item.title: Star Blizzard hackers abuse WhatsApp to target high-value diplomats
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Russian nation-state actor Star Blizzard has been running a new spear-phishing campaign to compromise WhatsApp accounts of targets in government, diplomacy, defense policy, international relations, and Ukraine aid organizations. [...]

item.title: FTC orders GM to stop collecting and selling driver’s data
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has announced action against General Motors (GM) and its subsidiary, OnStar, for unlawful collection and sale of drivers' precise geolocation and driving behavior data without first obtaining their consent. [...]

item.title: Microsoft removes Assassin’s Creed Windows 11 upgrade blocks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Earlier this week, Ubisoft released Assassin's Creed Valhalla and Assassin's Creed Origins patches to fix Windows 11 24H2 compatibility issues that caused crashes, freezes, and audio problems. [...]

item.title: FTC cracks down on Genshin Impact gacha loot box practices
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Genshin Impact developer Cognosphere (aka Hoyoverse) has agreed to a $20 million settlement with the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) over its gacha loot box monetization and is now banned from selling them to teens under the age of sixteen without parental consent. [...]

item.title: Otelier data breach exposes info, hotel reservations of millions
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Hotel management platform Otelier suffered a data breach after threat actors breached its Amazon S3 cloud storage to steal millions of guests' personal information and reservations for well-known hotel brands like Marriott, Hilton, and Hyatt. [...]

item.title: Malicious PyPi package steals Discord auth tokens from devs
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A malicious package named 'pycord-self' on the Python package index (PyPI) targets Discord developers to steal authentication tokens and plant a backdoor for remote control over the system. [...]
